For release, add `--github`:

`release.py -r 1 ign-math3 3.0.0 --ignition-repo -a ignition-math3 --github --dry-run`

values.description:
This PR replaces VS2017 for VS2019 in our Windows scripts. There are more changes that fix different things I found during testing, specially those affecting to colcon. 

* Replace VS2017 by VS2019
* Remove gazebo8 support. It is EOL.
* Support vcpkg installed in different units
* Workaround for colcon invocation
* Fix colcon test command
* Define MAKEFLAGS

I’ve [tested](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/vs2019/) different software:

* Gazebo10 \(cmake \+ custom deps\)
* Gazebo9 \(cmake \+ custom deps\)
* sdformat \(cmake \+ custom deps\)
* ign-gui \(colcon \+ vcpkg\)
* ign-sensors \(colcon \+ vcpkg\)

Gazebo default is waiting the merge from 10 branch to get fixes. Only[ ign-transport needs a fix right now](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-requests/405).

values.description:
Some black magic to automatically bump a -release repository to a new major version. Some operations and checks are automatically done. The output could show some FIXME warnings that need manual attention.

I tested it on the copy of ign-fuel-tools3:

[https://github.com/ignition-release/ign-fuel-tools4-release](https://github.com/ignition-release/ign-fuel-tools4-release) 

Run with:

‌

```
jrivero@nium ign-fuel-tools4-release $ ~/release-repo-scripts/bump_major_version.bash 3 4
Moving -release info
==============================
 - From: ignition-fuel-tools3
 - To  : ignition-fuel-tools4
=============================

 * Making unversioned file from ubuntu/debian/libignition-fuel-tools3.install
   - Move symlinks
     - move ./bionic/debian/libignition-fuel-tools3.install
     - move ./debian/sid/debian/libignition-fuel-tools3.install
 * Making unversioned file from ubuntu/debian/libignition-fuel-tools3-dev.install
   - Move symlinks
     - move ./bionic/debian/libignition-fuel-tools3-dev.install
     - move ./debian/sid/debian/libignition-fuel-tools3-dev.install

 * Renaming install files

 * Update changelogs
     ./bionic/debian/changelog
     ./debian/stretch/debian/changelog
     ./debian/sid/debian/changelog

 * Changing values in control file
 * Safety checks in control
    ! FIXME: Breaks clause detected in control file ./ubuntu/debian/control
    ! FIXME: Replaces clause detected in control file ./ubuntu/debian/control

 * Changing values in rules file

 * Safety checks in symlinks
    ! FIXME: Found broken link ./debian/stretch/debian/libignition-fuel-tools2.install
    ! FIXME: Found broken link ./debian/stretch/debian/libignition-fuel-tools2-dev.install
```

git status

```

On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

Changes to be committed:
  (use "git reset HEAD <file>..." to unstage)

	renamed:    bionic/debian/libignition-fuel-tools3-dev.install -> bionic/debian/libignition-fuel-tools4-dev.install
	renamed:    bionic/debian/libignition-fuel-tools3.install -> bionic/debian/libignition-fuel-tools4.install

	renamed:    ubuntu/debian/libignition-fuel-tools3.install -> ubuntu/debian/libignition-fuel-tools4.install

Changes not staged for commit:

  (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)

	modified:   bionic/debian/changelog

```

values.description:
The ignition-gui homebrew bottle builds seemed to fail all the time during the `brew test` phase, with console messages like:

~~~
[GUI] [Err] [Application.cc:653] [QT] Cannot create window: no screens available
~~~

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder%2Flabel%3Dosx_mojave&build=564)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_mojave/564/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_mojave/564/

I just remembered that we set the `DISPLAY` variable in the [project-default-devel-homebrew-amd64.bash](#!/osrf/release-tools/src/d4f731053e94e6dc78f4e60f77589ad88657d11b/jenkins-scripts/lib/project-default-devel-homebrew-amd64.bash#lines-101:107), so I added it to the bottle build script, and now it seems to be passing:

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder%2Flabel%3Dosx_mojave&build=565)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_mojave/565/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_mojave/565/
values.title: set DISPLAY when building bottles

values.description:

values.description:
There was a homebrew bug preventing all dependencies from being installed that was fixed in the following PR:

* https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/6807

It hasn't yet been released, and we use the `HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG` environment variable so that we use the latest release of brew instead of the tip of the master branch. The releases are usually more stable, but we need this fix, so I'm unsetting the `HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG`  variable until Dec 15; hopefully it is released by then.

testing: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_fuel-tools-ci-default-homebrew-amd64&build=49)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_fuel-tools-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/49/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_fuel-tools-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/49/

I do expect that build to fail, but with a compilation error, rather than a configuration error caused by missing dependencies.
values.title: use brew master branch for a little while since there's an unreleased bug fix

values.description:
Current code only uploaded source packages \(.dsc\) to the repository when the package being uploaded does not have any versions. The problem with this is that new versions of the same  package does not get the source package updated as well.

These changes try to detect new versions and upload them.

Only tried it for an already existing version:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=repository_uploader_packages&build=2880)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/repository\_uploader\_packages/2880/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/repository_uploader_packages/2880/))

‌

```
+ for pkg in '`ls $pkgs_path/*.dsc`'
+ pkg_name_clean=lark-parser_0.7.8-1osrf~focal.dsc
+ pkg_name=lark-parser
+ pkg_version=0.7.8-1osrf~focal.dsc
+ pkg_version=0.7.8-1osrf~focal
+ dsc_package_exists_and_equal_or_greater lark-parser 0.7.8-1osrf~focal
+ local pkg=lark-parser new_version=0.7.8-1osrf~focal
++ sudo GNUPGHOME=/var/lib/jenkins/.gnupg/ reprepro -T dsc ls lark-parser
++ grep focal
+ current_dsc_info='lark-parser |                  0.7.8-1osrf~focal |  focal | source'
+ [[ -z lark-parser |                  0.7.8-1osrf~focal |  focal | source ]]
++ awk '{ print $3 }'
+ current_version=0.7.8-1osrf~focal
++ dpkg --compare-versions 0.7.8-1osrf~focal lt 0.7.8-1osrf~focal
+ return 0
+ echo 'Source package for /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/repository_uploader_packages/pkgs/lark-parser_0.7.8-1osrf~focal.dsc already exists in the repo and it'\''s greater or equal than current version'
```

‌

Current code only uploaded source packages \(.dsc\) to the repository when the package being uploaded does not have any versions. The problem with this is that new versions of the same  package does not get the source package updated as well.

values.description:
When we import an hg repository to GitHub, all it imports all closed branches too are. This PR has a script that is intended to be executed when the current directory is a git repository. The script takes the URL of an hg repository as its argument, clones it to a temporary folder, and identifies the names of closed branches in that repository. It then checks if the git repository in the current folder has any remote branches that match the closed hg branch names, and uses `git push --delete` to delete them from the remote. I tested it on a fork:

* hg repo: * imported from https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics-release/
* imported to github: https://github.com/ignition-release/ign-physics2-release/branches
* my fork: https://github.com/scpeters/ign-physics2-release/branches

~~~
$ $RELEASE_TOOLS_PATH/jenkins-scripts/tools/git_delete_closed_hg_branches.bash \
 https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics-release
=========== Start Cloning HG Repository
requesting all changes
adding changesets
adding manifests
adding file changes
added 66 changesets with 154 changes to 59 files
new changesets 300f19c244d0:afc900c6a935 (3 drafts)
updating to branch default
53 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved
=========== Done Cloning HG Repository

=========== Identify Closed HG Branches
remote git branch found: build_dep_common3_profiler
To github.com:scpeters/ign-physics2-release.git
 - [deleted]         build_dep_common3_profiler
remote git branch found: control_dart6_utils-urdf
To github.com:scpeters/ign-physics2-release.git
 - [deleted]         control_dart6_utils-urdf
remote git branch found: dart69_2
To github.com:scpeters/ign-physics2-release.git
 - [deleted]         dart69_2
remote git branch found: dart_69
To github.com:scpeters/ign-physics2-release.git
 - [deleted]         dart_69
remote git branch found: explicit_dart7.4
To github.com:scpeters/ign-physics2-release.git
 - [deleted]         explicit_dart7.4
remote git branch found: multipackage
To github.com:scpeters/ign-physics2-release.git
 - [deleted]         multipackage
remote git branch found: release_1.0.0_pre2
To github.com:scpeters/ign-physics2-release.git
 - [deleted]         release_1.0.0_pre2
remote git branch found: use_collision_ode
To github.com:scpeters/ign-physics2-release.git
 - [deleted]         use_collision_ode
~~~

That deleted the closed branches. Running the script again:

~~~

 https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics-release

remote git branch not found: explicit_dart7.4
remote git branch not found: multipackage
remote git branch not found: release_1.0.0_pre2
remote git branch not found: use_collision_ode
~~~

values.description:
We have many hg repositories to migrate, so I've made a tool that queries the bitbucket REST API to categories the features used by all public (not private) hg repositories from a given owner (pull requests, issues and wiki). This will allow us to handle first the simple repositories with no issues, pull requests or wikis. It prints it out in markdown table format like the following:

~~~
$ ./bbhg_repo_table.py scpeters
# Bitbucket HG repositories
| Repository | pull requests | issues | wiki |
|--|--|--|--|
| scpeters/appveyor_vcpkg_cmake_hg | 0 |  |  |
| scpeters/physics_params_world | 0 |  |  |
| scpeters/bitbucket-client-tools | 0 | [X] |  |
| scpeters/ode | 0 | [X] |  |
| scpeters/gazebo-rpi | 0 | [X] | [X] |
~~~

which renders like:

# Bitbucket HG repositories
| Repository | pull requests | issues | wiki |
|--|--|--|--|
| scpeters/appveyor_vcpkg_cmake_hg | 0 |  |  |
| scpeters/physics_params_world | 0 |  |  |
| scpeters/bitbucket-client-tools | 0 | [X] |  |
| scpeters/ode | 0 | [X] |  |
| scpeters/gazebo-rpi | 0 | [X] | [X] |

I've generated tables for the osrf and ignitionrobotics orgs:

* https://bitbucket.org/snippets/scpeters/qnz6yn/ignitionrobotics-bitbucket-hg-repositories
* https://bitbucket.org/snippets/scpeters/GroXnR/osrf-bitbucket-hg-repositories

values.description:
The brew pull requests were not created successfully for two recent releases due to an error in the brew scripts:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater&build=607)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/607/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/607/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater&build=608)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/608/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/608/

They both have the following errors:

~~~
++ git -C /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/Homebrew/Library/Taps/osrf/homebrew-simulation fetch --unshallow
fatal: --unshallow on a complete repository does not make sense
Build step 'Execute shell' marked build as failure
~~~

I'm not sure why it is failing now, but I just added an `|| true` to ignore the error and now it's passing.

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater&build=609)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/609/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/609/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater&build=610)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/610/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/610/
values.title: brew: ignore errors during git fetch --unshallow

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater&build=607)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/607/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/607/
